name: Visual bed composition
functionStatement: Supports aquatic habitats through streambed material and bedform dynamics. Enhances habitat complexity and streambank stability.
descriptionMarkdown: Combines substrate size distribution, embeddedness, and consolidation or armoring to assess pore space and habitat quality.
howToMeasureMarkdown: Visually classify dominant substrate along the reach (bedrock, boulder, cobble, gravel, sand, silt or clay) and note the relative amount of fines and embedding.

levels.label: Optimal
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Bed composition matches expectations for the stream type with open interstitial space where coarse substrate is expected.

levels.label: Suboptimal
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Minor departure from expected composition or mild fine cover.

levels.label: Marginal
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Strong departure from expected composition, or widespread fine cover and embedding in coarse-bed settings.

levels.label: Poor
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Bed is dominated by fines or is heavily embedded or sealed, indicating poor habitat and limited exchange.
